dcp_server.fsimagestorage module

class dcp_server.fsimagestorage.FilesystemImageStorage(data_root, model_used)

Bases: object

Class used to deal with everything related to image storing and processing - loading, saving, transforming...

get_image_seg_pairs(directory)

Get pairs of (image, image_seg) Used, e.g., in training to create training data-training labels pairs

Parameters:

directory (str) -- path to the directory to search images and segmentations in

Returns:

list of tuple pairs (image, image_seg)

Return type:

list

get_image_size_properties(img, file_extension)

Get properties of the image size

Parameters:

  • img (ndarray) -- image (numpy array)

  • file_extension (str) -- file extension of the image as saved in the directory

Returns:

size properties: - height - width - z_axis

get_unsupported_files(directory)

Get unsupported files found in the given directory

Parameters:

directory (str) -- direcory path to search for files in

Returns:

list of unsupported files

Return type:

list

load_image(cur_selected_img, is_gray=True)

Load the image (using skiimage)

Parameters:

cur_selected_img (str) -- full path of the image that needs to be loaded

Returns:

loaded image

Return type:

ndarray

prepare_images_and_masks_for_training(train_img_mask_pairs)

Image and mask processing for training.

Parameters:

train_img_mask_pairs (list) -- list pairs of (image, image_seg) (as returned by get_image_seg_pairs() function)

Returns:

lists of processed images and masks

Return type:

list, list

rescale_image(img, height, width, channel_ax=None, order=2)

rescale image

Parameters:

  • img (ndarray) -- image

  • height (int) -- height of the image

  • width (int) -- width of the image

  • channel_ax (int) -- channel axis

Returns:

rescaled image

Return type:

ndarray

resize_mask(mask, height, width, channel_ax=None, order=2)

resize the mask so it matches the original image size

Parameters:

  • mask (ndarray) -- image

  • height (int) -- height of the image

  • width (int) -- width of the image

  • order (int) -- from scikit-image - the order of the spline interpolation, default is 0 if image.dtype is bool and 1 otherwise.

Returns:

resized image

Return type:

ndarray

save_image(to_save_path, img)

Save given image (using skiimage)

Parameters:

  • to_save_path (str) -- full path to the directory that the image needs to be save into (use also image name in the path, eg. '/users/new_image.png')

  • img (ndarray) -- image you wish to save

search_images(directory)

Get a list of full paths of the images in the directory

Parameters:

directory (str) -- path to the directory to search images in

Returns:

list of image paths found in the directory (only image types that are supported - see config.cfg 'setup' section)

Return type:

list

search_segs(cur_selected_img)

Returns a list of full paths of segmentations for an image

Parameters:

cur_selected_img (str) -- full path of the image which segmentations we need to find

Returns:

list segmentation paths for the given image

Return type:

list

dcp_server.models module

class dcp_server.models.CellClassifierFCNN(model_config, train_config, eval_config)

Bases: Module

Fully convolutional classifier for cell images.

Note

This model cannot be used as a standalone model in DCP

eval(img)

Evaluates the model on the provided image and return the predicted label.

Parameters:

img (np.ndarray[np.uint8]) -- Input image for evaluation.

Returns:

y_hat - predicted label.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

forward(x)

Performs forward pass of the CellClassifierFCNN.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) -- Input tensor.

Returns:

Output tensor after passing through the network.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

train(imgs, labels)

Trains the given model

Parameters:

  • imgs (List[np.ndarray[np.uint8]]) -- List of input images with shape (3, dx, dy).

  • labels (List[int]) -- List of classification labels.

training: bool
update_configs(train_config, eval_config)

Updates the training and evaluation configurations.

Parameters:

  • train_config (dict) -- Dictionary containing the training configuration.

  • eval_config (dict) -- Dictionary containing the evaluation configuration.

class dcp_server.models.CellClassifierShallowModel(model_config, train_config, eval_config)

Bases: object

This class implements a shallow model for cell classification using scikit-learn.

eval(X_test)

Evaluates the model on the provided test data.

Parameters:

X_test (numpy.ndarray) -- Features of the test data.

Returns:

y_hat - predicted labels.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

train(X_train, y_train)

Trains the model using the provided training data.

Parameters:

  • X_train (numpy.ndarray) -- Features of the training data.

  • y_train (numpy.ndarray) -- Labels of the training data.

class dcp_server.models.CellposePatchCNN(model_config, train_config, eval_config, model_name)

Bases: Module

Cellpose & patches of cells and then cnn to classify each patch.

eval(img)

Evaluate the model on the provided image and return the final mask.

Parameters:

img (np.ndarray[np.uint8]) -- Input image for evaluation.

Returns:

Final mask containing instance mask and class masks.

Return type:

np.ndarray[np.uint16]

train(imgs, masks)

Trains the given model. First trains the segmentor and then the clasiffier.

Parameters:

  • imgs (List[np.ndarray]) -- images to train on (training data)

  • masks (List[np.ndarray] of same shape as output of eval, i.e. one channel instances, second channel classes, so [2, H, W] or [2, 3, H, W] for 3D) -- masks of the given images (training labels)

training: bool
update_configs(train_config, eval_config)

Update the training and evaluation configurations.

Parameters:

  • train_config (dict) -- Dictionary containing the training configuration.

  • eval_config (dict) -- Dictionary containing the evaluation configuration.

class dcp_server.models.UNet(model_config, train_config, eval_config, model_name)

Bases: Module

Unet is a convolutional neural network architecture for semantic segmentation.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int) -- Number of input channels (default: 3).

  • out_channels (int) -- Number of output channels (default: 4).

  • features (list) -- List of feature channels for each encoder level (default: [64,128,256,512]).

class DoubleConv(in_channels, out_channels)

Bases: Module

DoubleConv module consists of two consecutive convolutional layers with batch normalization and ReLU activation functions.

Forward pass through the DoubleConv module.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) -- Input tensor.

predicted mask consists of instance and class masks

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) -- Input tensor.

model_name

self.in_channels = self.model_config["unet"]["in_channels"] self.out_channels = self.model_config["unet"]["out_channels"] self.features = self.model_config["unet"]["features"]

  • masks (list[numpy.ndarray]) -- Masks corresponding to the input images.

class dcp_server.segmentationclasses.MitoProjectSegmentation(imagestorage, runner, model)

Segmentation class inheriting the attributes and functions from the original GeneralSegmentation and implementing additional attributes and methods needed for this project.

async segment_image(input_path, list_of_images)

Segments images from the given directory. The function differs from the parent class' function in obtaining the outlines of the masks.

Parameters:

  • input_path (str) -- directory where the images are saved

  • list_of_images (list) -- list of image objects from the directory that are currently supported

class dcp_server.serviceclasses.CustomBentoService(runner, segmentation, service_name)

BentoML Service class. Contains all the functions necessary to serve the service with BentoML

start_service()

Starts the service

Returns:

service object needed in service.py and for the bentoml serve call.

class dcp_server.serviceclasses.CustomRunnable(model, save_model_path)

Bases: Runnable

BentoML, Runner represents a unit of computation that can be executed on a remote Python worker and scales independently. CustomRunnable is a custom runner defined to meet all the requirements needed for this project.

SUPPORTED_RESOURCES: tuple[str, ...] = ('cpu',)
SUPPORTS_CPU_MULTI_THREADING: bool = False
bentoml_runnable_methods__: dict[str, RunnableMethod[t.Any, t.Any, t.Any]] | None = {'evaluate': RunnableMethod(func=<function CustomRunnable.evaluate>, config=RunnableMethodConfig(batchable=False, batch_dim=(0, 0), input_spec=None, output_spec=None), _bentoml_runnable_method=None), 'train': RunnableMethod(func=<function CustomRunnable.train>, config=RunnableMethodConfig(batchable=False, batch_dim=(0, 0), input_spec=None, output_spec=None), _bentoml_runnable_method=None)}
check_and_load_model()

Checks if the specified model exists in BentoML's model repository. If the model exists, it loads the latest version of the model into memory.

evaluate(**kwargs: P.kwargs) → R
train(**kwargs: P.kwargs) → R

dcp_server.utils module

dcp_server.utils.create_dataset_for_rf(imgs, masks)

Extracts shape and intensity-based features from images within regions defined by masks.

Parameters:

  • imgs (list) -- A list of input images.

  • masks (list) -- A list of corresponding masks defining regions of interest.

Returns:

A list of arrays containing shape and intensity-based features.

Return type:

list

dcp_server.utils.create_patch_dataset(imgs, masks_classes, masks_instances, noise_intensity, max_patch_size, include_mask)

Splits images and masks into patches of equal size centered around the cells.

Parameters:

  • imgs (list of numpy.ndarray or torch.Tensor) -- A list of input images.

  • masks_classes (list of numpy.ndarray or torch.Tensor) -- A list of binary masks representing classes.

  • masks_instances (list of numpy.ndarray or torch.Tensor) -- A list of binary masks representing instances.

  • noise_intensity (float) -- The intensity of noise to add to the patches.

  • max_patch_size (float) -- The maximum size of the bounding box edge for objects in the mask.

  • include_mask (bool) -- A flag indicating whether to include the mask along with patches.

Returns:

A tuple containing the patches, patch masks, and labels.

Return type:

tuple

Note

If patch_size is not given, the algorithm should first run through all images to find the max cell size, and use the max cell size to define the patch size. All patches and masks should then be returned in the same format as imgs and masks (same type, i.e. check if tensor or np.array and same convention of dims, e.g. CxHxW)

dcp_server.utils.crop_centered_padded_patch(img: ndarray, patch_center_xy, patch_size, obj_label, mask: ndarray | None = None, noise_intensity=None) → ndarray

Crops a patch from an array x centered at coordinates c with size p, and apply padding if necessary.

Parameters:

  • img (np.ndarray) -- the input array from which the patch will be cropped

  • patch_center_xy (tuple) -- the coordinates (row, column) at the center of the patch

  • patch_size (tuple) -- the size of the patch to be cropped (height, width)

  • obj_label (int) -- the instance label of the mask at the patch

  • mask (np.ndarray, optional) -- The mask array associated with the array x. Mask is used during training to mask out non-central elements. For RandomForest, it is used to calculate pyradiomics features.

  • noise_intensity (float, optional) -- intensity of noise to be added to the background

Returns:

the cropped patch with applied padding

Return type:

np.ndarray

dcp_server.utils.extract_intensity_features(image, mask)

Extracts intensity-based features from an image within the region defined by the mask.

Parameters:

  • image (numpy.ndarray) -- The input image.

  • mask (numpy.ndarray) -- The mask defining the region of interest.

Returns:

An array containing the extracted intensity-based features, including median intensity, mean intensity, and 25th/75th percentile intensity within the masked region.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dcp_server.utils.find_max_patch_size(mask)

Finds the maximum patch size in a mask.

Parameters:

mask (numpy.ndarray) -- The binary mask representing objects.

Returns:

The maximum size of the bounding box edge for objects in the mask.

Return type:

float

dcp_server.utils.get_center_of_mass_and_label(mask: ndarray) → ndarray

Computes the centers of mass for each object in a mask.

Parameters:

mask (np.ndarray) -- the input mask containing labeled objects

Returns:

  • A list of tuples representing the coordinates (row, column) of the centers of mass for each object.

  • A list of ints representing the labels for each object in the mask.

Return type:

  • list of tuple

  • list of int

dcp_server.utils.get_centered_patches(img, mask, p_size: int, noise_intensity=5, mask_class=None, include_mask=False)

Extracts centered patches from the input image based on the centers of objects identified in the mask.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) -- The input image.

  • mask (numpy.ndarray) -- The mask representing the objects in the image.

  • p_size (int) -- The size of the patches to extract.

  • noise_intensity (float) -- The intensity of noise to add to the patches.

  • mask_class (int) -- The class represented in the patch.

  • include_mask (bool) -- Whether or not to include the mask as an input argument to the model.

Returns:

A tuple containing the following elements: - patches (numpy.ndarray): Extracted patches. - patch_masks (numpy.ndarray): Masks corresponding to the extracted patches. - instance_labels (list): Labels identifying each object instance in the extracted patches. - class_labels (list): Labels identifying the class of each object instance in the extracted patches.

Return type:

tuple

Parameters:

file (str) -- The file path.

Returns:

The extension of the file.

Return type:

str

mask (numpy.ndarray) -- The binary mask representing objects.

A list of slices indicating the bounding boxes of the found objects.

list

dcp_server.utils.get_shape_features(img, mask)

Calculate shape-based radiomic features from an image within the region defined by the mask.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) -- The input image.

  • mask (numpy.ndarray) -- The mask corresponding to the image.

Returns:

An array containing the calculated shape-based radiomic features, such as elongation, sphericity, and perimeter surface.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
